link.title: KIPP Philadelphia Schools – Work hard. Be Nice.

div.p: We are reinvigorating public education in Philadelphia.
Enroll your child at one of our schools.
We are proving that zip code does not determine destiny.
Give the gift of opportunity.
We are reinvigorating public education in Philadelphia.
Enroll your child at one of our schools.
We are proving that zip code does not determine destiny.
Give the gift of opportunity.

img.p: Our mission is that together with families and communities, we create joyful, academically excellent schools that prepare students to pursue the paths they choose—college, career, and beyond—so they can lead fulfilling lives and build a more just world.

div.p: Great schools require great teachers
Give the gift of opportunity
To and through college

li.p: of our students qualify for free or reduced meals
students are on our waitlist this year
of our students are African-American or Hispanic
of our students receive special education services
of KIPP Philadelphia alumni matriculate to college

div.p: "KIPP extends beyond the classroom, learning, growing, and developing as a person is something you can experience everyday of your life."
— Christopher Johnson, Class of 2011
"Even though I wasn’t at KIPP anymore, my former 5th grade teacher Ms. Larson still cared about me. That is why I decided to be a teacher, I believe in KIPP."
— Jessica Dixon, Class of 2012 and 6th Grade Teacher at KIPP West Philadelphia Preparatory Academy
"I credit KIPP with helping create a solid foundation and bright future for my kids. Let the world know that we need KIPP everywhere. We even need a KIPP college!"
— Annette Strickland, parent of 5 KIPPsters

"My teacher has taught me for 2 years now, and I honestly don’t think I’d be where I am right now in my life without her. She is intelligent, empathic, humorous, and exceedingly passionate about her subject and her students. I would and do tell other people that she is the most unique teacher I have met."
— KyReem Reams, Class of 2018
"Our teacher always pushes us to the max, accepting nothing but our personal best. Great teachers like him make a difference. He has truly made a positive impact on us."
— Munirah Small, Student Class of 2021

div.p:
KIPP Philadelphia Schools Regional Office • 5070 Parkside Avenue • Suite 3500D, Mailbox 41 • Philadelphia, PA 19131
Ph: 215.294.8596 • Fax: 215.252.7792 • Email: info@kippphiladelphia.org

span.p: KIPP Philadelphia Schools is committed to equal treatment for all individuals. KIPP does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, or national or ethnic origin.
